newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks close lower, seen falling.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks close lower, seen falling.

text.p: Pakistani stocks close lower on Sunday on selling pressure by foreign funds keen to square their positions before the end of 1996, dealers said.
The Karachi bourse will close on Monday for a local religious holiday and reopen on Tuesday.
The 100-share index closed 19.46 points, or 1.33 percent, lower at 1,441.12 amid 178 losers and 75 gainers.
"Some selling by foreign investors before the end of the year lowered the index," dealer Ali Raza said. The fall was more conspicuous in investment stocks than others, he added.
"In the present circumstances, some gradual downward adjustment may continue," Raza said.

Major investors kept to the sidelines amid political uncertainty, another dealer said. Parke-Davis fell 9.00 rupees to 585, PSO 4.00 to 373, ICI 0.35 to 22.45, PTCL 0.45 to 28.10, HUBCO 0.60 to 33.60 and Dewan Salman 1.20 to 35.80.
all-share index 1,010.64 1,018.46 Market capitalisation in billion rupees 496.21 500.04 Trading value in billion rupees 0.96 1.01
